snippet: Hiring topped the 200,000 mark for the fifth month in a row as industries as varied as health care, manufacturing, financial services and retailing all added workers.
abstract: Labor Dept reports that American employers added 288,000 jobs in June, fifth month in row that hiring has topped 200,000 mark, and jobless rate declined to 6.1 percent, best reading since Sept 2008; despite gains, economy is still long way from its peak before recession began at end of 2007.
lead_paragraph: Hiring topped the 200,000 mark for the fifth month in a row as industries as varied as health care, manufacturing, financial services and retailing all added workers.

headline.main: Hiring Is Strong and Jobless Rate Declines to 6.1%
headline.print_headline: Hiring Is Strong and Jobless Rate Declines to 6.1%
